intro: Gagea deserticola, commonly known as the desert gagea, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that help it survive in harsh environments. Gagea deserticola is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
